column2: justfeathers, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am not sure that it was this drug that has caused his problem's today, but I am not giving him this drug tomorrow until I consult with his doctor. Within an hour after taking his first pill he became sweaty, confused, pale, low BP, labored resporations and low pulse. He has other conditions that could contribute to this, such as diabetes, but his blood surgar was 121, so that was ruled out as a contributing factor. These symptoms has continued throughout the day in a lesser degree. Putting into mind his medical condition, and the fact that the only new medication he has taken in this drug, I feel confident in questioning this drug until I speek to his Primary Care, and his Cardiologist, before continuing treatment.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking candesartan for 2 years, but my blood pressure has recently risen. I was prescribed 1mg doxazosin to use with the candesartan. I suffer from epilepsy which is controlled. column2: Gaudium, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Doctors tried many drugs to lower by BP without success. I was placed on a 2 mg dose of Cardura.  After my first dose of Cardura my pressure dropped from 190/94 to 116/60.  I was weak and tired for about a week then life returned to normal.  The Daily 2 mg dose of Cardura maintained my BP for almost two years, pressure increased to 180/88 and again doctors attempted to lower it with many other drugs without success.  My Cardura was increased to 4 mg each day and my pressure lowered to 136/76.  I have some of the side effects listed by others including edema of the lower legs but would rather have the side effects than be deceased.  Just a note to the record I am also taking a combination of drugs for the control of my blood pressure this combination fails the minute Cardura is withdrawn.

column2: noscreenname, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

All dosages, noticed drowsy-groggy when waking up, slow to wake. Will consult Dr and probably stop treatment. Possibly back to Flomax.
